segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2003 Firewall for App-V
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2003 Firewall for App-V

segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2003 Firewall for App-V
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2003 Firewall for App-V

segment.source: How to Configure Windows Server 2003 Firewall for App-V
segment.target: How to Configure Windows Server 2003 Firewall for App-V

segment.source: Use the following procedure to configure the Windows Server 2003 firewall for App-V.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to configure the Windows Server 2003 firewall for App-V.

segment.source: To configure Windows Server 2003 firewall for App-V
segment.target: To configure Windows Server 2003 firewall for App-V

segment.source: In Control Panel, open the Windows Firewall.
segment.target: In Control Panel, open the Windows Firewall.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the server has not been configured to run the firewall service before this step, you will be prompted to start the firewall service.
segment.target: If the server has not been configured to run the firewall service before this step, you will be prompted to start the firewall service.

segment.source: If ICO and OSD files are published through SMB, ensure that File and Printer Sharing is enabled on the Exceptions tab.
segment.target: If ICO and OSD files are published through SMB, ensure that File and Printer Sharing is enabled on the Exceptions tab.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If ICO and OSD files are published through HTTP/HTTPS on the Management Server, you might need to add an exception for HTTP or HTTPS.
segment.target: If ICO and OSD files are published through HTTP/HTTPS on the Management Server, you might need to add an exception for HTTP or HTTPS.

segment.source: If the IIS server hosting the ICO and OSD files is hosted on a computer separate from the Management Server, you need to add the exception to that computer.
segment.target: If the IIS server hosting the ICO and OSD files is hosted on a computer separate from the Management Server, you need to add the exception to that computer.

segment.source: To maximize performance, it is recommended that you host the ICO and OSD files on a separate server from the Management Server.
segment.target: To maximize performance, it is recommended that you host the ICO and OSD files on a separate server from the Management Server.

segment.source: Add a program exception for , which is the Management Server service executable.
segment.target: Add a program exception for , which is the Management Server service executable.

originalData.data: `%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft System Center App Virt Management Server\App Virt Management Server\bin`

segment.source: The default path to this executable is .
segment.target: The default path to this executable is .

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the Management Server uses RTSP for communication, you must also add a program exception for .
segment.target: If the Management Server uses RTSP for communication, you must also add a program exception for .

segment.source: The App-V Streaming Server requires a program exception for RTSPS communication.
segment.target: The App-V Streaming Server requires a program exception for RTSPS communication.

segment.source: The App-V Streaming Server that uses RTSP for communication also requires a program exception for .
segment.target: The App-V Streaming Server that uses RTSP for communication also requires a program exception for .

segment.source: Ensure that the proper scope is configured for each exception.
segment.target: Ensure that the proper scope is configured for each exception.

segment.source: To reduce risk, remove any computer and strictly limit the IP addresses to which the server will respond.
segment.target: To reduce risk, remove any computer and strictly limit the IP addresses to which the server will respond.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics
